notes.note: The label of the change language button
A very short label for the navbar map label
A very short label for the navbar about page button

segment.source: The digital home for a physical movement. Whether you're a beginner looking for your first wall or a pro searching for a challenge, this is where the Parkour community maps the world.
Landing in a new city? Don't waste time scrolling. Use the Top Rated view to find the legendary spots the locals love. From the streets to the rooftops, the map speaks your language.

Your training doesn't stop for the weather. Need a covered rail for a rainy night? A lit spot for a winter session? Or a Parkour gym for drills? Our Smart Filters let you dial in the exact training conditions you need.
steps Find Parkour parks and gyms

A map is only useful if it's accurate. We prioritize Active Training. Through community check-ins and verified organization updates, we are building a living heatmap of where the sport is actually happening right now.
Training happens outside, not behind a desk. Take the full power of PK Spot with you - verified spots, smart filters, and session logging, right in your pocket.
Download PK Spot from the Apple App Store. Get the seamless experience on your iPhone or iPad.
Get the full-screen app experience directly from your browser. Open the menu and select "Add to Home Screen" or "Install" to access PK Spot instantly on any device.
We believe the map belongs to the athletes, not a corporation. That's why PK Spot is built differently.

We don't lock your world behind a paywall. All community spot data is released publicly to the community and is licensed under Creative Commons CC BY-NC-SA 4.0. It is open, shareable, and yours forever.
We are Open Source. No black-box algorithms, no hidden tracking. Just cutting-edge web tech built to serve the community.
We care deeply about your privacy. We do not sell your data — ever. No tracking cookies, no shady ad networks. Just the essentials to keep the platform running.
Fueled by Passion, Community and Partners
PK Spot is a free utility tool built by athletes. We don't charge you to use the map, and we never will.
To keep the servers running, we partner with the Parkour ecosystem — National Associations, ethical brands, and Parkour Gyms. We support the organizations that support the sport.
Whether you are a solo athlete, a Parkour gym owner, or a national organization - we are happy to have you on board.
Crafted in Zürich, Switzerland. Open Data. Open Code. ©2026 PK Spot.

segment.source: This is the date you started practicing Parkour and Freerunning. It will be rounded to full years after one year or more so don't sweat it.

notes.note: The text in the spot list panel if no spots are found/displayed

segment.source: There are no highlighted spots for this area, zoom in on dots in the map to discover other spots.
What would you like to report this spot for?
It's a private spot and should not be on this spot map.
Which spot is this spot a duplicate of?
Note: Spot reports are public and will be displayed on the spot itself together with your profile and user name.
What would you rate this spot from one to five stars?
Find answers to common questions or reach out to us directly.
Have a question, found a bug, or want to request a feature? We'd love to hear from you!
Join our Discord server to chat with the community, report bugs, and request features. This is the fastest way to get help!
For formal inquiries, partnerships, or issues that require privacy, reach out via email.
Feel free to slide into our DMs! We're happy to help with quick questions.
Can't find what you're looking for? Join our Discord and we'll help you out!
We're excited to have you join our Parkour and Freerunning community. Here you can explore spots, share posts, and connect with other practitioners. 🤸

Remember that Parkour has inherent risks and you are responsible for your own safety. Our spots are user-submitted and their accuracy and legality are not guaranteed. Always respect property rights and local laws.

PK Spot is built by the community. By contributing content, you grant us the license needed to operate the service, as detailed in our Terms of Service. We then share the combined spot data back to the public under a protective, non-commercial license (CC BY-NC-SA 4.0) to keep it an open resource for everyone.
Essential features (like Google Maps) may use cookies 🍪. To protect your privacy, we use a privacy-focused, cookie-free analytics service.
By clicking "Agree & Continue", you accept our Terms of Service and acknowledge our Privacy Policy.
Please select the reason for this report:

source.pc: Not a picture of this spot: This image does not show the location or is misleading.
Bad quality: This picture is blurry, too dark, or generally poor quality.
Duplicate: This image is already present on this spot.
Copyright infringement: This is my content and I did not give permission for it to be used here.
I'm visible and have a problem with it.
This picture violates the terms of service in other ways (nudity, violence, etc.)

segment.source: We'll only use your email to contact you about this report.

notes.note: The text before the localized location of the spot. E.g. Parkour spot in Wiedikon, Zurich, CH

segment.source: Is this an indoor or outdoor spot?
Is there a water feature (fountain, river, lake etc.)?
Is there drinking water available right at the spot?
Download PK Spot from the Google Play Store. Get the seamless experience on your Android device.
This is a sketchy or mental challenge that requires physical and emotional control
The goal of this challenge is to be creative. This challenge may also be more open to interpretation.
This techy challenge requires great precision and control.
A core challenge of this spot. An essential challenge for anyone seeking to master this spot.
This is an indoor training facility with dedicated equipment and obstacles for Parkour practice.
This is a trampoline park facility that has aerial training areas.
This is a gymnastics facility with mats, bars, beams, and tumbling equipment suitable for acrobatic training.
This is a purpose-built outdoor space with designed obstacles and structures for Parkour training.
This is a playground area with swings, slides, and climbing structures suitable for Parkour training.
This is a school facility with walls, benches, and architectural features for practice.
This is a public park with paths, benches, and landscaping features.
This is an urban area with walls, railings, stairs, and architectural elements.
This is a natural area with trees, rocks, logs, and terrain features.
This is a university campus with varied buildings, courtyards, and outdoor structures.
This is an art installation or sculpture that can be used for Parkour practice. Please respect the artwork and surrounding area.
This is a rooftop area with ledges, walls, and elevated structures.
This is a roof gap requiring precision jumping between buildings.
This is a spot primarily used for descending techniques.
This location is a monument, historical ruin, stone marker, or culturally significant structure. Please be respectful and cautious while training here.
This spot centers around water (fountain, riverbank, lakeside structure, etc.) offering unique movement or aesthetic value. Surfaces may be slippery—use caution.
This is a parking garage or car park with ramps, columns, and concrete structures suitable for training.
This is a skate park with ramps, rails, and concrete structures suitable for training. Make sure to give way to skaters and be respectful at the skate park.
This is a calisthenics park with bars and beams suitable for training. Be respectful to others and use the equipment carefully.
This is a location that doesn't fit standard categories but offers training opportunities.
This is a public spot, which is open to everyone and can be accessed freely without restrictions.
This is a commercial facility that requires membership or paid entry. You must be a member or pay a fee to access this spot. Please respect the facility's rules and hours of operation.

This is a residential area and private property. Access is generally limited to residents or their guests. Please be especially mindful of noise and privacy. Training here may lead to being asked to leave.
This is private property. While some respectful practice may be tolerated, permission is always recommended to avoid issues.
This is private property and strictly off-limits without explicit, prior permission from the owner. Unauthorized access may result in legal action or injury.
The access type of this spot is not specified. Please check local regulations and guidelines before visiting.
